qas.question: Who did Bell get to read his work?
What country was doing work similar to Bell's?
Who wrote The Sensations of Tone as a Physiological Basis for the Theory of Music?
How old was Bell when he wrote his paper?
What fictional character is based on Alexander Ellis?

context: At the age of <a3_0>19<a3_0/>, he wrote a report on his work and sent it to philologist <a0_0>Alexander Ellis<a0_0/>, a colleague of his father (who would later be portrayed as <a4_0>Professor Henry Higgins<a4_0/> in Pygmalion). Ellis immediately wrote back indicating that the experiments were similar to existing work in <a1_0>Germany<a1_0/>, and also lent Bell a copy of <a2_0>Hermann von Helmholtz<a2_0/>'s work, The Sensations of Tone as a Physiological Basis for the Theory of Music.
